result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Lee Britt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Benjamin Lee Britt. Per agreement, defendant will plead to all counts. State recommends 3 years WSPS (18 months in and 18 months out) for each count, concurrent to each other but consecutive to any sentences currently serving with the following conditions for extended supervision: pay court costs, provide a DNA sample, submit to random UAs, and to participate in counseling. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to all counts. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Frank heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 3 years WSPS (18 months in and 18 months out) stayed with the following conditions: submit to random UAs, participate in counseling deemed appropriate, and to pay 1 set of court costs. Court imposes 3 years probation with the following conditions: to pay 1 set of court costs, submit to random drug testing, participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate, and to provide a DNA sample. Court finds defendant eligible for programming.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Benjamin Lee Britt. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to all counts. State will recommend 3 years prisons (18 months in and 18 months out) consecutive to previous sentence with the following conditions: pay court costs, provide a DNA sample, submit to random UAs, and counseling that DOC deems appropriate. Attorney Frank heard on agreement and requests sentencing to be at a later date. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Defendant heard. Attorney Frank heard and requests to withdrawal as counsel. Court heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and requests the defendant to submit to a drug test. Court takes a short recess.  Court back on record and discusses test results with defendant. Attorney Frank withdraws his motion to withdraw and requests another date. Attorney Pozorski heard and requests a $1000 cash bond. Attorney Frank heard and requests a signature bond. Court heard on bench warrant in Monroe County. Court orders $250 cash bond with a condition that the defendant submit to random UAs upon request of law enforcement or court official. Plea and sentencing date set.
Defendant shall submit to random urinalysis upon request of law enforcement or court official.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Benjamin Lee Britt. Attorney Frank heard on status of case and requests a plea and sentencing date. Plea and sentencing date set.
